title.rendered: The Student Shift to Virtual During COVID-19

content.rendered:
In summer 2020, Handshake surveyed over 1,000 students on how they have responded to the shift to virtual during COVID-19.

The survey explored three key themes:

  • How has COVID-19 impacted the mental health and wellbeing of students?
  • How are students navigating virtual recruiting?
  • How have students adapted to the challenges of remote work?

The breakdown of the survey respondents is as follows:

  • Institution type: 55% public college/university, 24% private college/university, 21% community college
  • School year: 32% first year, 28% second year, 20% third year, 20% fourth year
  • Age group: 79% age 17-21, 21% age 22-24
  • Gender: 45% male, 53% female, 2% other or prefer not to answer
See our survey results in the “Student Shift to Virtual During COVID-19” Infographic

Interested in more insights on the impacts of COVID-19 on higher ed from the perspective of career services leaders? Read the Handshake Career Services Report: COVID-19 & Fall 2020.

excerpt.rendered: In summer 2020, Handshake surveyed over 1,000 college and university students in the U.S. Here’s what we learned.
